title: Part 1
description: This very special window from these ageless Windows to the Past will open to the exciting and tragic life of the Bab. The history of the awescme life of the Bab is presented in story form. To convey the spirit of the events, the long Persian names, which have a tendency to overwhelm the Western audience, are avoided.

title: Part 2
description: This very special window from these ageless Windows to the Past will open to the exciting and tragic life of the Bab. The history of the awescme life of the Bab is presented in story form. To convey the spirit of the events, the long Persian names, which have a tendency to overwhelm the Western audience, are avoided.

title: The Promised One
description: In this reading, we explore a story from early Baha'i history, sourced from famed Baha'i historian Nabil's much celebrated opus "The Dawn-Breakers". We hear of the Bab's summoning to a convocation of religious leaders in Tabriz, and the extraordinary pronouncement He made at that gathering.

title: Roses of Ridvan
description: This is an account from the historian Nabil, one of those present at the Ridvan Garden in Baghdad in 1863 when Baha'u'llah announced His Mission as the Promised One of all religions. This description is quoted in Shoghi Effendi's seminal history of the early years of the Baha'i Faith, God Passes By, and is read beautifully here by Corinne.

title: Nora Crossley
description: This is the story of Nora Crossley and her sacrifice of cutting off her long auburn hair to raise money for the construction of the Baha'i Temple in North America, a sacrifice which was heralded by Abdu'l-Baha as an act of "imperishable glory".

title: 10 Women of Shiraz
description:
June 18, 2023 will mark 40 years since 10 Baha’i women were hanged in Shiraz. Their only ‘crime’ was their refusal to renounce their beliefs in a faith that promotes the principles of gender equality, unity, justice, and truthfulness.

Today, in the blood, tears and wounds of thousands of young women in Iran fighting for equality, we can see the legacy of the 10 women of Shiraz whose tragic death touched the lives of many.

With this video, we honour not only the anniversary of these 10 women but we honour all women who have contributed to building a better Iran through their suffering, to say that our story is one.

To participate in the Our Story is One campaign, visit this special website by the Baha'i International Community: www.ourstoryisone.bic.org/

For more artistic expressions and resources related to the ongoing persecution of the Baha'is in Iran, visit this Baha'i Blog collection: www.bahaiblog.net/collection/theme…-bahais-in-iran/

Narration: Corinne

Photos courtesy of the Baha'i International Community sourced from the Archives of Baha'i Persecution in Iran - iranbahaipersecution.bic.org/

Music:
Lights by Danijel Zambo
uppbeat.io/t/danijel-zambo/lights
License code: 2SAUUOTJENAKTINN

Lament by Arend
uppbeat.io/t/arend/lament
License code: LZEQ4PKRN01OPQMI

title: Anis
description:
This is the story of Anis Zunuzi, the youth who was executed alongside the Bab on July 9th, 1850. You can watch this story in animated form on our YouTube channel: www.youtube.com/watch?v=s2fsmrQ38Z0

Read more about Anis in this Baha'i Blog article: www.bahaiblog.net/articles/history…ute-anis-zunuzi/

Find more resources related to the Martyrdom of the Bab and its significance: www.bahaiblog.net/collection/calen…rdom-of-the-bab/

Music: "The East Wind" by Simon Folwar

title: Introduction
description:
The team at First Valley Books has graciously given Baha'i Blog permission to share the audiobook of 'Mighty'. Told through the eyes of a traveller, a doctor, an aristocrat, a writer, a young boy, a wealthy woman, and a little girl, ‘Mighty’ consists of seven stories about Abdu’l-Baha. His extraordinary life of love, justice, compassion and humility will inspire children to be of service to the world.

Written and narrated by Shirin Taherzadeh. Artwork by Alyssa de Asis.

The book is available on www.firstvalleybooks.com

You can also listen to this story on Baha'i Blog's YouTube channel here: www.youtube.com/watch?v=FQWmVSFrYeA

title: Part 2
description:
Since the original release of the Windowsto the Past series,
an interest has grown in making these brief and accessible histories
availablein printed form. Hence, the present publication, the first
to be edited and to become available in a form other than a simple
transcription.
